title: Governance-Contract Coverage Baseline — S302
expect: Governance coverage ≥90% for lane fields; bridge file propagation possibly incomplete; enforcement automation gaps exist
method: Score 4 governance surfaces: (1) SWARM-LANES field coverage, (2) bridge file protocol propagation, (3) enforcement mechanism inventory, (4) challenge system throughput. Apply RAG (Red/Amber/Green) rating per surface.

known_gaps: 8 lanes with legacy available=ready (should be yes)
lane_field_coverage.note: Field presence is high (94-99%) but staleness is alarming: 46.7% of active lanes have not been updated in >3 sessions. Governance contracts exist but are not being maintained.

minimum_swarmed_cycle.note: Critical protocol section (check-mode + expect-act-diff + bridge sync) absent in Cursor and Windsurf bridges.

bridge_file_protocol_propagation.enforcement: MANUAL — CLAUDE.md instructs 'keep bridge files synchronized' but no automated scanner
bridge_file_protocol_propagation.note: Minimum Swarmed Cycle missing from 2/6 bridge files. These tools would start sessions without check_mode, expect-act-diff, or bridge-sync requirements. No automated propagation audit.

manual_only.requirement: CLAUDE.md: mirror protocol-critical guidance across all bridge files
SWARM-LANES protocol: lanes stale >10 sessions = ABANDONED

manual_only.gap: maintenance flags 8 lanes but no auto-fix

enforcement_mechanisms.note: Core enforcement is automated and working. Bridge sync is the critical manual-only gap. Stale lane cleanup is flagged but requires human/node action.

challenge_system.challenge_throughput: unknown — no session-level challenge rate tracked
challenge_system.note: Zero pending challenges could mean healthy alignment OR underchallenging (P-164: >80% confirmation rate is a red flag). F-GOV3 needs throughput measurement to distinguish.

top_governance_gaps.gap: Bridge file protocol propagation — Minimum Swarmed Cycle missing from .cursorrules and .windsurfrules (33% drift)
top_governance_gaps.impact: high — Cursor/Windsurf sessions start without check_mode, expect-act-diff, bridge-sync requirements

top_governance_gaps.gap: Active lane staleness — 50/107 ACTIVE lanes not updated in >3 sessions (46.7%)
top_governance_gaps.impact: medium — stale lanes create coordination confusion and SWARM-LANES bloat (C3)

top_governance_gaps.gap: No automated bridge file sync scanner — CLAUDE.md instructs sync but no enforcement tool
top_governance_gaps.impact: medium — protocol drift accumulates silently across tools

actual: Lane field coverage is HIGH (94-99% presence). Bridge protocol propagation is RED (33% gap — Minimum Swarmed Cycle missing from Cursor + Windsurf). Enforcement is AMBER (core automated, bridge sync manual). Challenge system is AMBER (0 pending, throughput unknown).
diff: Expected ≥90% lane coverage — confirmed. Unexpected: bridge file drift is larger than assumed (2/6 bridges missing a critical protocol section). Staleness rate at 46.7% is higher than expected — active lanes are governance contracts that have expired without resolution.
next_steps: Add Minimum Swarmed Cycle to .cursorrules and .windsurfrules (F-GOV2 first action)
Add automated bridge file scanner to maintenance.py — check for required protocol sections in all 6 bridge files
F-GOV3: measure challenge-resolution throughput (track open-time per challenge)
